newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo corn futures end lower in all months.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo corn futures end lower in all months.

text.p: Tokyo corn futures closed lower on Friday in all months, following an overnight fall on the Chicago market, traders said.
Prices ranged from 110 to 200 yen lower, with benchmark July closing down 110 yen at 13,420 yen per tonne. Estimated volume was 80,560 lots.

Individual investors, discouraged by the drop in Chicago, liquidated long positions, traders said. "Investors were hesitant to build fresh positions ahead of the weekend," a brokerage house trader said.
The spot July corn contract on the CBOT Project A overnight trading system stood at $2.49-1/2 per bushel at 0800 GMT, down from $2.50-1/4 at Thursday's close.
Spot July CBOT soybean futures were trading at $7.97 a bushel at 0800 GMT, against $8.00-1/2 at Thursday's close.
